Description: Marl pottery cylinder jar with modelled arch pattern in band around upper body and decorated in red paint with widely spaced cross-hatched pattern.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Fort Cemetery Grave 126 (Hierakonpolis)
Curator's comments: Like 46k in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic Pottery (1953). Grave 126 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 129, where this pot is mis-identified as Proto 46d8
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
